title: Principles and Applications of Near-Infrared Multispectral Imaging Technology

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational optical theory, understanding of spectroscopy, and metasurface technology
context.additional_context: Advanced technical training for working professionals, structured around real-time interaction and hands-on practice

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core principles of near-infrared multispectral imaging technology and compare its advantages over existing systems.
Learners can understand the design process of metasurface-based multi-wavelength separation devices and analyze the application methods of deep learning models.
Learners can simulate the operation of an imaging system utilizing resonance modes occurring in the 1150nm, 1350nm, and 1550nm wavelength bands.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
